title.justification: The title is mentioned explicitly at the beginning of the provided research paper.

extractions.description: This paper introduces PySCFIPU, a hardware-accelerated data generator using Intelligence Processing Units (IPUs) for creating large quantum chemistry datasets. The researchers used PySCFIPU to generate QM1B, a dataset with one billion training examples containing 9-11 heavy atoms. They demonstrate that a simple neural network, SchNet 9M, improves performance as the volume of training data increases.

type.justification: The paper involves experiments and practical implementation, such as using PySCFIPU to generate QM1B and evaluating the performance of SchNet 9M model with the dataset.
type.quote: This allowed us to create the dataset QM1B with one billion training examples containing 9-11 heavy atoms. We demonstrate that a simple baseline neural network (SchNet 9M) improves its performance by simply increasing the amount of training data without additional inductive biases.

name.justification: The research focuses on generating large datasets for molecular machine learning and evaluating their effectiveness in training neural networks to approximate quantum chemistry predictions.
name.quote: A promising approach within molecular machine learning is to train neural networks (NN) to approximate the predictions of quantum chemistry, yielding 1000x faster predictions with errors approaching that of experimental measurement.

name.justification: The paper deals with generating datasets based on Density Functional Theory (DFT) predictions, which is a major aspect of quantum chemistry.
name.quote: These datasets are limited in size because the labels are computed using the accurate (but computationally demanding) predictions of Density Functional Theory (DFT).

name.justification: A significant part of the paper discusses the use of Intelligence Processing Units (IPUs) for accelerating the DFT data generation process.
name.quote: We introduce PySCFIPU, a DFT data generator which utilises Intelligence Processing Units (IPUs) to accelerate molecular property dataset generation.

name.justification: The SchNet 9M model is explicitly mentioned and evaluated within the scope of the paper.
name.quote: We demonstrate that a simple baseline neural network (SchNet 9M) improves its performance by simply increasing the amount of training data without additional inductive biases.

is_contributed.justification: The model is used as a baseline to demonstrate the efficacy of the generated dataset; it is not a novel contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: To investigate whether more training data improves neural networks, we trained a baseline SchNet with 9M parameters on differently sized subsets of QM1B.

is_executed.justification: The SchNet 9M model was executed to validate its performance on the QM1B dataset.
is_executed.quote: Training a SchNet 9M model to predict HL gap shows improvement as the number of training samples approaches 500M.

is_compared.justification: The performance of SchNet 9M is compared to its own performance on different sizes of the dataset.
is_compared.quote: We trained a baseline SchNet with 9M parameters on differently sized subsets of QM1B.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for the SchNet model is correctly identified in the provided paper.

name.justification: QM1B is the primary dataset generated and discussed in this paper.
name.quote: We used PySCFIPU to generate QM1B with one billion DFT training examples within 40000 IPU hours.

referenced_paper_title.justification: QM1B is a novel dataset introduced in this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We introduce the data generator PySCFIPU using Intelligence Processing Units (IPUs). This allowed us to create the dataset QM1B with one billion training examples containing 9-11 heavy atoms.

name.justification: QM9 is mentioned as a reference dataset used for fine-tuning the models.
name.quote: After pre-training SchNet on QM1B we fine-tuned SchNet on QM9.

referenced_paper_title.value: Quantum Chemistry Structures and Properties of 134 Kilo Molecules
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper describes the creation and utility of the QM9 dataset.

name.justification: PySCFIPU is the primary software tool introduced and discussed throughout the paper for generating the QM1B dataset.
name.quote: We introduce PySCFIPU , a DFT data generator which utilises Intelligence Processing Units (IPUs) to accelerate molecular property dataset generation.

referenced_paper_title.justification: PySCFIPU is a novel contribution introduced in this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We present PySCFIPU , a new hardware accelerated DFT data generator for deep learning.
